section.title: Initialize the Installer Environment
section.para: In this section you initialize the installer environment and browse to the installation UI.

step.para: On the deployer01 node, while logged in as the ardana user and from the ardana user's home directory, enter the following command to initialize the installer environment:
step.screen: ARDANA_INIT_AUTO=1 /usr/bin/ardana-init
step.para: You should see some Ansible playbooks run resulting in green ok= messages and yellow changed= messages. If there are any red failed= messages, review the output of the commands to determine the cause.
On thedeployer01 node, open a web browser and point to:
step.screen: http://localhost:9085
step.para: You should see the SUSE OpenStack Cloud Deployer screen.

section.title: Select the Deployment Model
section.para: In this section you select the model to deploy the cloud.

step.para: On the welcome screen of the SUSE OpenStack Cloud Deployer, click Next.
From the list of models, select an option to test. We recommend using the Entry-Scale Cloud. For more information, see in the Deployment Guide. Click Next.
On the left, under Mandatory Components, select Lifecycle Manager Nodes. On the right, in the Edit number of nodes text box enter: 1.
Under Mandatory Components, select Controller Nodes. On the right, in the Edit number of nodes text box enter: 1.
On the left, under Additional Components, select Compute Nodes. On the right, in the Edit minimum number of nodes text box enter: 1.
Click Next.

procedure.title: Configure Cloud DNS, Hostnames and NTP

step.para: On the next screen (Add Servers and Assign Server Roles), in the top right, click Manage Cloud Settings.
On the Manage Cloud Settings window select the Cloud Configuration tab.
Enter the following:
step.screen: Host Name Prefix: ardana Host Member Prefix: -m DNS Name Servers: 192.168.200.1 NTP Servers: 192.168.200.1

step.para: Click Save.
Close the Manage Cloud Settings window.
On the top right, click Manage Cloud Settings.
On the Manage Cloud Settings window select the Disk Models tab.
On the Manage Cloud Settings window select the Disk Models tab. You should see the following disk models listed:
step.screen: COMPUTE-DISKS CONTROLLER-1TB-DISKS CONTROLLER-600GB-DISKS LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-DISKS

step.para: If you do not see the LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-DISKS listed, continue with the next task. If you do see these interface models, review each model configuration and make sure that it matches the configuration specified here.

procedure.title: OPTIONAL: Configure the Lifecycle Manager Disk Model

note.para: Only continue with this procedure if you completed the above task and did not see LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-DISKS listed.

step.para: Click Add disk model.
On the right hand side, in the Disk model name field enter:
step.screen: LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-DISKS

step.para: Click Add volume group. Under Add volume group, enter the following:
step.screen: Volume group name: ardana-vg Physical volume: /dev/sda_root
step.para: To add a new logical volume, click: Add logical volume.
Under Add logical volume, enter the following:
step.screen: Logical volume name: root Size: 80 Mount: / File system type: ext4 mkfs command options: (leave empty)
step.para: To save the logical volume configuration, click Save. Back under Logical volume (under Add volume group) you should see the new logical volume listed.
To add another logical volume, click Add logical volume. Under Add logical volume, enter the following:
step.screen: Logical volume name: crash Size: 15 Mount: /var/crash File system type: ext4 mkfs command options: -O large_file
step.para: To save the logical volume configuration, click Save. You should see the new logical volume listed.
To save the volume group configuration, click Save. You should see the new volume group listed.
To save the disk model configuration, click Save. You should see the new disk model listed.
On the screen Server and Server Role Summary, in the top right, click Manage Cloud Settings.
On the Manage Cloud Settings window select the NIC mappings tab. You should see the following disk models listed:
step.screen: COMPUTE-6PORT CONTROLLER-6PORT LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-2PORT

step.para: If you do not see any of these listed, continue with the next task. If you do see these listed, review each NIC mapping configuration and make sure that it matches the configuration specified here.

note.para: Only continue with this procedure if you completed the above task and did not see any NIC mappings listed.

step.para: On the Manage Cloud Settings â€“ NIC Mapping window click Add NIC Mapping.
On the right of that window, to create a NIC mapping for the controller nodes, enter the following:
step.screen: NIC Mapping Name: CONTROLLER-6PORT Port Logical Name: eth0 PCI Address: 0000:00:03.0

step.para: Click the + on the right of the port/PCI address line to add a second line. Enter the following on the second line:
step.screen: Port Logical Name: eth1 PCI Address: 0000:00:07.0

step.para: Click the + on the right of the port/PCI address line to add a third line. Enter the following on the third line:
step.screen: Port Logical Name: eth2 PCI Address: 0000:00:08.0

step.para: Click the + on the right of the port/PCI address line to add a forth line. Enter the following on the forth line:
step.screen: Port Logical Name: eth3 PCI Address: 0000:00:10.0

step.para: Click the + on the right of the port/PCI address line to add a fifth line. Enter the following on the fifth line:
step.screen: Port Logical Name: eth4 PCI Address: 0000:00:11.0

step.para: Click the + on the right of the port/PCI address line to add a fifth line. Enter the following on the fifth line:
step.screen: Port Logical Name: eth5 PCI Address: 0000:00:12.0

step.para: Click Save.
Repeat the previous task to create a new NIC mapping for the compute nodes using COMPUTE-6PORT for the name. Use the same port names and PCI addresses as the controllers.
On the Manage Cloud Settings â€“ NIC Mapping window click Add NIC Mapping.
On the right of that window, to create a NIC mapping for the controller nodes, enter the following:
step.screen: NIC Mapping Name: LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-1PORT Port Logical Name: eth0 PCI Address: 0000:00:03.0

step.para: Click Save.
On the Server and Server Role Summary window, in the top right, click Manage Cloud Settings.
On the Manage Cloud Settings window select the Interface Models tab. You should see the following disk models listed:
step.screen: COMPUTE-INTERFACES-3-BONDS CONTROLLER-INTERFACES-3-BONDS LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-INTERFACES-1-BOND

step.para: If you do not see any of these interface models, continue with the next task. If you do see these interface models, review each model configuration and make sure that it matches the configuration specified here.

procedure.title: Configure the Lifecycle Manager Interface Model

step.para: Click Add interface model. In the Interface model field enter:
step.screen: LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-INTERFACES-1-BOND

step.para: Under Interfaces, click Add Network Interface. Enter the following:
step.screen: Network Interface Name: BOND0 Network Devices: eth0 Network Devices: eth1 Forced Network Groups: None Network Groups: MANAGEMENT Bond device name: bond0 Bond options: miimon: 200 mode: active-backup primary: eth0

step.para: Click Save.

procedure.title: Configure the Compute Node Interface Model

step.para: On the right side of the COMPUTE-INTERFACES network click the edit button.
On the right, in the Edit Interface Model section, under Interfaces, delete any existing interfaces by clicking the trash can icon on their right. When asked if you are sure, click Yes.
Click Add Network Interface. Enter the following:
step.screen: Network Interface Name: BOND0 Network Devices: eth0 Network Devices: eth1 Forced Network Groups: None Network Groups: MANAGEMENT Network Groups: GUEST Bond device name: bond0 Bond options: miimon: 200 mode: active-backup primary: eth0

step.para: Click Save.
Click Add Network Interface. Enter the following:
step.screen: Network Interface Name: BOND1 Network Devices: eth2 Network Devices: eth3 Forced Network Groups: None Network Groups: EXTERNAL-VM Bond device name: bond1 Bond options: miimon: 200 mode: active-backup primary: eth0

step.para: Click Add Network Interface. Enter the following:
step.screen: Network Interface Name: BOND2 Network Devices: eth4 Network Devices: eth5 Forced Network Groups: None Network Groups: STORAGE Bond device name: bond2 Bond options: miimon: 200 mode: active-backup primary: eth0

step.para: Click Save.
To save the Interface Model, click Save.

procedure.title: Configure the Controller Node Interface Model

step.para: On the right side of the CONTROLLER-INTERFACES network click the edit button.
On the right, in the Edit Interface Model section, under Interfaces, delete any existing interfaces by clicking the trash can icon on their right. When asked if you are sure, click Yes.
Click Add Network Interface. Enter the following:
step.screen: Network Interface Name: BOND0 Network Devices: eth0 Network Devices: eth1 Forced Network Groups: None Network Groups: MANAGEMENT Network Groups: GUEST Bond device name: bond0 Bond options: miimon: 200 mode: active-backup primary: eth0

step.para: Click Save.
Click Add Network Interface. Enter the following:
step.screen: Network Interface Name: BOND1 Network Devices: eth2 Network Devices: eth3 Forced Network Groups: None Network Groups: EXTERNAL-API Network Groups: EXTERNAL-VM Bond device name: bond1 Bond options: miimon: 200 mode: active-backup primary: eth0

step.para: Click Add Network Interface. Enter the following:
step.screen: Network Interface Name: BOND2 Network Devices: eth4 Network Devices: eth5 Forced Network Groups: None Network Groups: STORAGE Bond device name: bond2 Bond options: miimon: 200 mode: active-backup primary: eth0

step.para: Click Save.
To save the Interface Model, click Save.
On the Server and Server Role Summary window, in the top right, click Manage Cloud Settings.
On the Manage Cloud Settings window select the Networks tab.
On the right side of the MANAGEMENT-NET network click the edit button.
On the right, in the Edit Network area, enter the following:
step.screen: VLAN ID: (accept default) CIDR: 192.168.200.0/24 Addresses: (leave empty) Gateway IP: 192.168.200.1 Network Groups: MANAGEMENT Tagged VLAN: (unchecked)

step.para: Click Save.
On the right side of the EXTERNAL-API-NET network click the edit button.
On the right, in the Edit Network area, enter the following:
step.screen: VLAN ID: (accept default) CIDR: 192.168.201.0/24 Addresses: (leave empty) Gateway IP: 192.168.201.1 Network Groups: EXTERNAL-API Tagged VLAN: (unchecked)

step.para: Click Save.
On the right side of the EXTERNAL-VM-NET network click the edit button.
On the right, in the Edit Network area, enter the following:
step.screen: VLAN ID: (accept default) CIDR: (leave empty) Addresses: (leave empty) Gateway IP: (leave empty) Network Groups: EXTERNAL-VM Tagged VLAN: (unchecked)

step.para: Click Save.
On the right side of the GUEST-NET network click the edit button.
On the right, in the Edit Network area, enter the following:
step.screen: VLAN ID: (accept default) CIDR: 192.168.203.0/24 Addresses: (leave empty) Gateway IP: 192.168.203.1 Network Groups: GUEST Tagged VLAN: (unchecked)

step.para: Click Save.
On the right side of the STORAGE-NET network click the edit button.
On the right, in the Edit Network area, enter the following:
step.screen: VLAN ID: (accept default) CIDR: 192.168.204.0/24 Addresses: (leave empty) Gateway IP: 192.168.204.1 Network Groups: STORAGE Tagged VLAN: (unchecked)

step.para: Click Save.
Close the Manage Cloud Settings window.

section.title: Deploy SLES on the Cloud Servers
section.para: This exercise deploys SLES on the cloud node servers.

step.para: On the Add Servers and Assign Server Roles window, in the top right, click Manage Subnet and Netmask.
On the Manage Subnet and Netmask screen enter the values for the management network:
Click Save.
If the list of servers in cluster0 is not displayed, click on the cluster0 bar on the right to expand the list of servers.
Edit the deployer node by clicking on the edit button.
On the Edit Server Details window for the deloyer node, enter the following:
step.screen:
ID: deployer
IP Address: 192.168.200.10 Server Group: RACK1 NIC Mapping: LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-2PORT
MAC Address: 52:54:00:00:01:01 IPMI IP Address: (leave empty) IPMI Username: (leave empty) IPMI Password: (leave empty)

step.para: Click Done.
On the Add Servers and Assign Server Roles window if the list of servers in cluster1 is not displayed, click on the cluster1 bar on the right to expand the list of servers.
Edit the first controller node by clicking on the edit button.
On the Edit Server Details window for the first controller02 node, enter the following:
step.screen:
ID: controller02
IP Address: 192.168.200.12 Server Group: RACK1 NIC Mapping: CONTROLLER-6PORT
MAC Address: 52:54:00:00:a2:01 IPMI IP Address: 192.168.199.12 IPMI Username: admin IPMI Password: password

step.para: Click Done.

If there are any additional controller nodes listed, delete the additional controller nodes from the list by clicking on the trash can icon on their right. Click Yes when asked if you are sure you want to delete them.
On the Add Servers and Assign Server Roles if the list of servers in compute is not displayed, click on the compute bar on the right to expand the list of servers.
Edit the first compute node by clicking on the edit button.
On the Edit Server Details window for the first compute node, enter the following:
step.screen:
ID: compute03
IP Address: 192.168.200.23 Server Group: RACK1 NIC Mapping: COMPUTE-6PORT
MAC Address: 52:54:00:00:c3:01 IPMI IP Address: 192.168.199.23 IPMI Username: admin IPMI Password: password

step.para: Click Done.

If there are any additional compute nodes listed, delete the additional compute nodes from the list by clicking on the trash can icon on their right. Click Yes when asked if you are sure you want to delete them.
Click Next.

procedure.title: Install SLES on the Cloud Servers

step.para: On the Choose servers on which SLES will be installed window, enter the following:
step.screen: Password: linux

step.para:
To move the controller and compute severs displayed in the Available Servers box on the left to the Selected Servers box on the right, click the > icon between the boxes.
You should see the controller and computer servers in the right box now instead of the left box.

warning.para: Do not move the deployer server to the right.

step.para: Click Install. When asked if you want to continue, click Yes.
When the servers finish installing, click Next.
On the Server and server role summary window, in the upper right hand side, click Expand all to review the configuration proposals for the servers.
Click Next.
On the Server and server role summary window, click Expand all. You should see all of the servers, their roles, IDs, IP addresses, Server groups, NIC Mappings and MAC Addresses.
If any issues are present, fix them here before moving on.
When all server configuration parameters have been verified or fixed click Next.
